html:
My heart shall cry out for Moab. The pronoun my refers either to God or to Isaiah; both are experiencing great emotional pain because of the destruction of Moab's inhabitants.

his fugitives shall flee unto Zoar. Zoar is located near the southern end of the Dead Sea; the fugitives are fleeing south, away from the heat of the battle.

heifer of three years old. A heifer of three years old is "in her strength," or full of vigor. Zoar was strong but soon would be destroyed when Sennacherib, king of Assyria, invaded.

for by the mounting up of Luhith with weeping. As the fugitives flee from the battles and destruction toward Luhith, a Moabite city in the south near Zoar, they will weep.

for in the way of Horonaim they shall raise up a cry of destruction. The inhabitants of Horonaim, a Moabite city near Zoar, will wail for the loss of their homeland.
